column5: Jan. 10 (Xinhua) — Cambodia’s two state-owned ports – Sihanoukville Autonomous Port (PAS) and Phnom Penh Autonomous Port (PPAP) – have seen remarkable growth in profits in 2018
column6: a Transport Ministry’s annual report showed on Thursday.------PAS
column8: made a net profit of 8.97 million U.S. dollars last year
column9: up 43 percent compared to a year earlier
column10: said the report released at the end of the ministry’s annual conference.------The listed seaport handled 537
column14: up 17 percent compared to the year before
column16: adding that containerized cargo tonnage increased 19 percent to almost 5.2 million tons.------According to the report
column18: which is the country’s second largest container hub
column19: recorded a net profit of 7.35 million U.S. dollars in 2018
column20: up 36 percent compared to 2017.------The freshwater port received 205
column24: adding that containerized cargo tonnage rose 3.7 percent to 2.9 million tons.------Transport Minister Sun Chanthol said to further boost the handling capacity of the two ports
column25: the country would start the construction of a new container terminal at each port this year.------“One new container terminal
column26: with a length of 350 meters and a depth of 14.5 meters
column27: will be built at the PAS at the cost of 203 million U.S. dollars
column28: and the other one will be constructed at the PPAP
column29: ” he said at the closing ceremony of the annual conference. ------http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2019-01/10/c_137734542.htm
